Name: Explore Scientific Deep Sky 16MP Astro Camera - Colour
Description:
This high resolution and very capable deep sky Astro camera comes with a large Panasonic CMOS sensor and active camera cooling.
With the new Explore Scientific Deep Sky Astro camera you get a modern complete package for the comfortable shooting of astro photos and videos. Finally, an easy-to-use camera for capturing galaxies, star clusters, the moon and even planets with high resolution and very low sensor noise. Thanks to the fast USB 3.0 computer interface, all image data is transferred within a seconds. Long waiting times are now a thing of the past.
Simply connect the camera to your telescope using the T2 female thread (M42.0.75mm) or the supplied 2" (50.8mm) plug-in adapter and after installing the drivers and the included 'Explore Capture' recording and editing software, you are ready to take your Astro photos to the next level.
The Explore Capture Pro software included not only offers the basic functions required for image and video capture, but also many helpful special functions for image post-processing and camera setup. Functions such as live image display, exposure settings, white balance, dark image print, stacking, time-lapse recording and so much more can be configured separately.

Choose to use the automatic settings to produce absolutely fantastic results without any previous knowledge or simply switch off the automatic settings and adjust the individual professional settings to your own preference - Its up to you.
The new Explore Deep Sky Camera has a highly sensitive and very low-noise Panasonic CMOS sensor which can also be cooled down to 40°C below ambient temperature by the two-stage thermoelectric cooling. In contrast to normal DSLR cameras, this guarantees much lower noise and fewer hot pixels in your shots. This results in images that are not only much sharper and more brilliant, but also contain more usable image information.

Through the controlled setting of the desired camera temperature, you can now produce dark frames under reproducible shooting conditions at any time. The large-format CMOS sensor with 21.9mm diagonal also allows large image fields and makes the adjustment and centering of objects considerably easier. 
The camera has a built-in USB hub with 2 x USB2.0 ports at the rear. Connect your additional Auto-guider camera or motor focus etc. via a short USB cable and reduce the risk of cable spaghetti and cable breaks. Separate cable connections between your accessories and your computer are also no longer necessary. 

Key Camera Features:
  • Camera type: ASTRO Camera 16.0MP ATR3CMOS16000KPA 
  • Data output: single pictures and video 
  • Image Sensor: Panasonic NM34230PLI CMOS Color Sensor 
  • Adjustable resolution: 4648x3506 / 2304x1750 / 1536x1168 
  • Adjustable binning: 1x1 / 2x2 / 3x3 
  • Frame rate per second (FBS): 22.5 / 43 / 48 
  • Physical sensor size in pixels: 4648 x 3506 
  • Megapixel: 16 MP 
  • Sensor size: 17.6 x 13.3 mm (4/3 inch) 
  • Pixel size: 3.8 µm x 3.8 µm 
  • Bit depth: 12 Bit 
  • Backfocus: 17,5 mm  
  • Shutter Type: rolling shutter
  • Internal camera memory: DDR 3 RAM
  • Thermoelectric cooling with fan: yes, up to 40°C below ambient temperature 
  • Adjustable exposure times: 150µs to 60min 
  • Operating temperature: -10 to +50°C (30-80% RLH) 
  • Cable length USB 3.0: 150cm 
  • DC cable length power supply: 200cm 
  • CNC machined aluminium housing 
  • Camera diameter: 80mm; length: 102mm 
  • Camera weight: 0,53 kg 
  • Camera connection diameter: 2.0 inch ( 50.8mm) 
  • Camera connection thread: T2 (M42x0,75mm) 
  • Filter thread: Yes, 2.0 inch in receptacle 
  • Camera connection to PC: USB 3.0 
  • Built-in USB hub with 2 x USB 2.0 ports 
  • Power supply: Power supply 12 Volt 3,0 Ampere included 
  • Software: EXPLORE Capture included 
  • Camera driver and ASCOM driver included
  • Operating system: WINDOWS 7, 8 and 10 
  • PC requirements: CPU Intel Core2 2.8Ghz or higher / 2 GB Ram / USB 3.0
General Technical Data:
  • One Shot Colour Astro Camera 16.0MP
  • Material: Blue - Aluminium Casing
  • Dimensions: Length 102mm, Diameter 80mm
  • Net Weight: 530g (without Accessories) 
  • Telescope adapter T2 thread to 2.0" (50,8mm) 
  • USB 3.0 connection cable 150cm 
  • Power supply 230V/12V3,0A (Included) 
  • Dust cap
  • Software CD 
  • Hard case 
  • Instruction manual

Name: Air Blower Bulb
Description:
Keep your Telescope and camera optics in pristine condition. This Air Blower is a simple yet an essential part of any astronomers Telescope maintenance kit. This simple device allows you to blow off any particles or fine dust either prior to use or prior to cleaning your telescope optics.

Simply squeeze the large bulb to create a jet of air through the nozzle to safely blow off any small particles or dust off your optics. This is also the first important step when cleaning your optics as it helps to prevents minute particles getting rubbed into your lens or mirrors during the cleaning process which can cause small surface scratches.

Features:

  • Perfect for blowing off any dust or particles from your Telescope correctors, eyepieces, filters and camera sensors prior to fitting to your telescope.
  • Can be used on Lenses, Mirrors, Cameras, Eyepieces, Filters and all other optical equipment

Name: Bresser Messier EXOS-2 GOTO German Equatorial Mount
Description:
The Bresser EXOS-2 GoTo German Equatorial Mount is a full GOTO mount with tracking motors in both axes that follow celestial objects very precisely and can be accurately controlled using the 'Star Tracker' hand controller.

Precision ball bearings in both axes of the mount ensures minimal backlash during all nine possible tracking speeds and the mount can be powered by a 12V battery pack which is conveniently fastened to the tripod shelf and takes eight size "D" batteries. You can also power the mount using a suitable mains adapter or 12V car plug adapter. The rigid tripod and mount assembly allows a generous payload of up to 13kg - perfect for small to medium sized Telescopes.
EXOS-2 GOTO System:
The Startracker GoTo System enables beginners with little experience to start astronomical observations in just a few minutes, and guides you to various objects in the night sky that are not visible through the small finder scope.

At the push of a button you can locate Planets, Nebulae or Galaxies in minutes. The database on the Startracker system holds thousands of celestial objects to choose from.

The Bresser StarTracker GoTo systems also uses servo motors for both axes and features an ST-4 compatible autoguiding input - essential for long exposure Astrophotography. The menu and navigation of the Startracker hand controller is also multilingual and offers a choice of German, English, French, Spanish and Italian.
Mount Spec:

  • Stable parallactic mount with fine drive in both axes
  • Ball bearings in both axes for more precise movements
  • Stable height adjustable stainless steel tripod ( Min. 69cm / Max. 109,5cm )
  • Max Payload: 13kg (10kg Photographic)
  • Circular bubble for easy horizontal alignment
  • GoTo Mount with motors and hand box controller, for easy finding and guiding moon, planets, stars and much more
  • ST-4 compatible autoguider interface
  • Pole height scale for setting the latitude
  • Scaled graduated circular rings to facilitate finding objects using a star atlas or planetarium software
  • Pole finder scope
  • Tripod weight: 4.6 kg
  • Mount weight: 5.3 kg (without counterweight)
  • Total weight incl. counterweight: 19.1 kg
  • Batteries: Eight size D (not included)
  • Equatorial EXOS 2 GOTO mount with stainless steel tripod and StarTracker hand controller
  • All GOTO, Tracking and Autoguiding operations carried out via the Star Tracker Hand Controller - Not recommended for use with ASCOM 
  • Adjustable polar finder scope with optional illumination
  • Stainless steel tube field tripod with accessory tray
  • 1 x 4.5 kg counterweight

Weight & Dimensions:

  • Total length: 1000 mm
  • Total width: 1000 mm
  • Total height: 1600 mm
  • Maximum load capacity: 13 kg
  • Net Weight total (incl. accessories): 15kg
  • Net weight mount (incl. accessories): 5 kg
  • Net weight tripod (incl. accessories): 4.9 kg
  • Counterweight: 1 x 4.5 kg

Whats included:

  • Equatorial EXOS 2 GOTO mount with stainless steel tripod and Startracker handcontroller
  • Adjustable polar finder scope with optional illumination
  • Stainless steel tube field tripod with accessory tray
  • 1 x 4.5 kg counterweight

Name: Bresser Messier EXOS-2 German Equatorial Mount
Description:
The Bresser Messier EXOS-2 (EQ-5) is a rugged equatorial mount with high rigidity and precision tracking, making it ideal for visual observation and astrophotography. Vibrations are also suppressed very effectively thanks to its sturdy Tripod assembly.

As with all of the Bresser Messier range, the EXOS-2 is made to a high quality finish and has an illuminated polar finder scope and precise graduated circles for ease of use. Although this mount is a manual German Equatorial Mount, a powered two-axis GoTo upgrade Kit is available as an optional extra, giving you the benefits of a fully computerised GOTO Mount. The Bresser EXOS-2 has a generous payload of up to 13 kg which allows you to use refractors of up to 152 mm aperture and mirror telescopes of up to 203 mm aperture.
Mount Spec:

  • Stable parallactic mount with fine drive in both axes
  • Ball bearings in both axes for more precise movements
  • Stable height adjustable stainless steel tripod (min. 69 cm / max. 109,5 cm )
  • Max Payload: 13kg (10kg Photographic)
  • Optional Bresser Star Tracker Goto Kit
  • Circular bubble for easy horizontal alignment
  • Pole height scale for setting the latitude
  • Scaled graduated circular rings to facilitate finding objects using a star atlas or planetarium software
  • Pole finder scope with optional illumination
  • Tripod weight: 4.6 kg
  • Mount weight: 5.3 kg (without counterweight)
  • Total weight incl. counterweight: 19.1 kg
  • Batteries: Eight size D (not included)
  • GOTO: No
  • Colour white
  • Material Metal
  • Product series: Messier range.
  • Included: Mount, Height adjustable Tripod, 2x Flexible Shaft, Polar Finder Scope, 4.5 Kilogram Counterweight

Weight & Dimensions:

  • Net weight (without access.): 4.5kg
  • Net Weight total (incl. accessories): 14.5kg
  • Net weight tripod (incl. accessories): 4.9 kg

Whats included:

  • BRESSER EXOS-2 mount (Non-GOTO)
  • Adjustable polar finder scope
  • Stainless steel tube field tripod with accessory tray
  • 1x 4.5 kg counterweight

Name: Bresser Messier NT-203/800 EXOS-2 GOTO - 8"
Description:
For many years Bresser Newtonian telescopes have become the standard workhorse for Deep Sky astrophotography, now the second generation of this telescope, the Bresser NT-203s/800 comes with an improved Hexafoc focusser and fast parabolic main mirror.

The Bresser NT-203s/800 f3.9 will deliver you much more detailed images at shorter exposures due to its oversized primary mirror and therefore faster optical system (f3.9, compared to standard f5 telescopes of this size). The large 85 mm secondary mirror also helps reduce vignetting for maximum optimal illumination of the target. The excellent 2,5" Hexafoc focuser also helps reduce vignetting due to its large diameter and makes focussing a joy - the smoothness and shifting-free operation sets a new standard in this price class.
BRESSER EXOS-2 GoTo Equatorial Mount:
This German Equatorial Mount has tracking motors in both axes that follow celestial objects very smoothly and precisely. The hand controller with full GOTO abilities works reliably and is very user friendly - See Manual download below. Precision ball bearings in both axes help ensure minimal backlash at all nine possible tracking speeds and the 12V battery pack is conveniently fastened to the tripod shelf and takes eight size D batteries. The mount can also be powered using a mains or car plug adapter (sold seperately)
EXOS-2 GOTO System:
The Startracker GoTo System enables beginners with little experience to start astronomical observations in just a few minutes, and guides you to various objects in the nigt sky that are not visible through the small finder scope. At the push of a button you can locate Planets, Nebulae or Galaxies in minutes. The database on the Startracker system holds thousands of celestial objects to choose from.
The Bresser StarTracker GoTo systems also uses servo motors for both axes and features an ST-4 compatible autoguiding input - essential for long exposure Astrophotography. The menu and navigation of the Startracker hand controller is also multilingual and offers a choice of German, English, French, Spanish and Italian.
Telescope Spec:

  • Optical design: Newtonian Reflector
  • Mirror diameter: 203mm / focal length: 800mm / F/3.9
  • Maximum recommended magnification: x 406
  • Telescope for night and solar observing

  • Backfocus fully inward focused: 60mm

  • Tube without accessories: 8.7 kg - Tube with all accessories mounted: 11.5 kg

SAFETY NOTICE: Never look directly at the Sun through your Binoculars or Telescope - immediate and permanent eye damage may result. For Solar viewing please ensure you have a dedicated Solar Filter fitted correctly to your telescope.
